segments.text: I can’t believe how serene the garden looks through the window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then my eyes shift to the kitchen, and a wave of dread washes over me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so deep in her task, it’s as if the rest of the world doesn’t exist for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s holding that plate like it’s the most precious thing, yet water is cascading around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so close to the cookie jar, a tiny daredevil on a shaky stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me uneasy to watch him reach up so high; it feels like an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks like she’s awaiting her prize, full of innocent anticipation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they realize how dangerous their game is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The beauty of the scene is overshadowed by the risks lurking in the corner.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I almost want to rush in and save them from themselves, but I’m stuck just watching.
segments.speaker: PAR
